Authors: Kacamarga M.F., Budiarto A., Pardamean B.
Title: A platform for electronic health record sharing in environments with scarce resource using cloud computing
Source title: International journal of online and biomedical engineering
Authors with affiliations: Kacamarga, M.F., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Budiarto, A., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: One of the main objectives of Electronic Health Record (EHR) is the transferability of patient data from one location to another. Many locations with scarce resources, particularly unreliable internet connectivity, face difficulties in accessing and sharing EHR data. This article presents our proposed design that utilizes Amazon Web Services (AWS) for a sharing mechanism platform among distributed healthcare organizations found in an environment with scarce resources. We proposed the use of database replication mechanism and REST (Representational State Transfer) web service to perform information exchange among health organizations and public health information systems. © 2020 Kassel University Press GmbH.
Author Keywords: Cloud computing; Database replication; EHR; Web service

Authors: Budiarto A., Kacamarga M.F., Suparyanto T., Purnamasari S., Caraka R.E., Muljo H.H., Pardamean B.
Title: SMARTD Web-Based Monitoring and Evaluation System
Source title: 1st 2018 Indonesian Association for Pattern Recognition International Conference, INAPR 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Mathematical Sciences, National University of Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; Accounting Information Systems Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Budiarto, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kacamarga, M.F., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suparyanto, T., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Purnamasari, S., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Caraka, R.E., School of Mathematical Sciences, National University of Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; Muljo, H.H., Accounting Information Systems Program, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Sustainable Management of Agricultural Research and Technology Dissemination (SMARTD) is a national program organized by Indonesian Agency for Agricultural Research and Development (IAARD), The Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Indonesia. It provides funding to increase research capacity in all units under IAARD. Because of the large scope of this program, a good monitoring and evaluation system is needed to ensure its effectiveness. A web-based application is proposed to complement the existing manual monitoring system. Design Thinking method and SCRUM are used as the approach to develop system. This system was developed using PHP 5 with Code Igniter framework and the database was developed using MySQL. This system has successfully implemented to all units under IAARD and are running smoothly for daily reporting system. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Evaluation; Information System; Monitoring; Reporting System; Web Application
Index Keywords: Agriculture; Information systems; Pattern recognition; Research and development management; Websites; Agricultural research; Daily reporting system; Evaluation; Monitoring and evaluations; Reporting systems; Sustainable management; WEB application; Web-based applications; Monitoring
Funding Text 1: I. INTRODUCTION SMARTD is one of important programs from the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Indonesia in order to increase the resource capacity within the Indonesian Agency for Agricultural Research and Development (IAARD) for the period of 2012 – 2018. This project’s scopes include funded project for human resources development, research infrastructure development and research collaboration. SMARTD activities are mainly funded through the World Bank's long-term loan and the Indonesian Government budget as a matching fund.
Funding Text 2: ACKNOWLEDGMENT This project is mainly funded by IAARD, Ministry of Agriculture of Republic of Indonesia. All system development processes were done using Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center (BDSRC) facility, at the University of Bina Nusantara.

Authors: Kacamarga M.F., Cenggoro T.W., Budiarto A., Rahutomo R., Pardamean B.
Title: Analysis of acoustic features in gender identification model for English and Bahasa Indonesia telephone speeches
Affiliations: Eureka.ai; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia

Abstract: One of the most interesting topics in auditory problem is determining gender of the speaker. In recent years, machine learning has gained significant attentions as a way to build a classifier from labeled data which also can be implemented to build a gender classifier. In this study we develop gender classifier using two different datasets with different languages, English and Bahasa Indonesia. Each data from both datasets is represented by 20 acoustic features. Multi Layer Perceptron (MLP) is used to build the classification model using all these features and trained only on English dataset. This model is evaluated in both dataset to get the performance matrices consist of accuracy, AUROC, precision and recall. Ultimately, using this model we also identify and compare important features from both dataset to see the different characteristics of English and Bahasa Indonesia speeches. © 2019 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V. This is an open access article under the CC BY-NC-ND license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/) Peer-review under responsibility of the scientific committee of the 4th International Conference on Computer Science and Computational Intelligence 2019.

Authors: Baurley J.W., Budiarto A., Kacamarga M.F., Pardamean B.
Title: A web portal for rice crop improvements
Affiliations: Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Baurley, J.W., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Budiarto, A., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kacamarga, M.F., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: High quality models of factors influencing rice crop yield are needed in countries where rice is a staple food. These models can help select optimal rice varieties for expected field conditions. Development of a system to help scientist track and make decisions using this data is challenging. It involves incorporation of complex data structures - genomic, phenotypic, and remote sensing - with computationally intensive statistical modeling. In this article, the authors present a web portal designed to help researchers to manage and analyze their datasets, apply machine learning to detect how factors taken together influence crop production, and summarize the results to help scientists make decisions based on the learned models. The authors developed the system to be easily accessed by the entire team including rice scientist, genetics, and farmers. As such, they developed a system on a server architecture comprised of a SQLite database, a web interface developed in Python, the Celery job scheduler, and statistical computing in R. Copyright © 2018, IGI Global.
Author Keywords: Crop Improvements; Data Science; Databases; High Performance Computing; Machine Learning; Web Portals

Authors: Mcmahan C., Baurley J., Bridges W., Joyner C., Kacamarga M.F., Lund R., Pardamean C., Pardamean B.
Title: A Bayesian hierarchical model for identifying significant polygenic effects while controlling for confounding and repeated measures
Source title: Statistical Applications in Genetics and Molecular Biology
Affiliations: Department of Mathematical Sciences, Clemson University, Clemson, SC, United States; Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Mcmahan, C., Department of Mathematical Sciences, Clemson University, Clemson, SC, United States, Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Baurley, J., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bridges, W., Department of Mathematical Sciences, Clemson University, Clemson, SC, United States; Joyner, C., Department of Mathematical Sciences, Clemson University, Clemson, SC, United States; Kacamarga, M.F., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Lund, R., Department of Mathematical Sciences, Clemson University, Clemson, SC, United States; Pardamean, C., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Genomic studies of plants often seek to identify genetic factors associated with desirable traits. The process of evaluating genetic markers one by one (i.e. a marginal analysis) may not identify important polygenic and environmental effects. Further, confounding due to growing conditions/factors and genetic similarities among plant varieties may influence conclusions. When developing new plant varieties to optimize yield or thrive in future adverse conditions (e.g. flood, drought), scientists seek a complete understanding of how the factors influence desirable traits. Motivated by a study design that measures rice yield across different seasons, fields, and plant varieties in Indonesia, we develop a regression method that identifies significant genomic factors, while simultaneously controlling for field factors and genetic similarities in the plant varieties. Our approach develops a Bayesian maximum a posteriori probability (MAP) estimator under a generalized double Pareto shrinkage prior. Through a hierarchical representation of the proposed model, a novel and computationally efficient expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm is developed for variable selection and estimation. The performance of the proposed approach is demonstrated through simulation and is used to analyze rice yields from a pilot study conducted by the Indonesian Center for Rice Research. © 2017 Walter de Gruyter GmbH, Berlin/Boston.
Author Keywords: Bayesian hierarchical models; EM algorithm; genomic studies; MAP estimator; rice science; shrinkage prior

Authors: Kacamarga M.F., Baurley J.W., Pardamean B.
Title: Parallel genome-wide analysis with central and graphic processing units
Source title: Proceedings of 2015 IEEE International Conference on Computer and Communications, ICCC 2015
Affiliations: Bioinformatics and Data Science, Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kacamarga, M.F., Bioinformatics and Data Science, Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Baurley, J.W., Bioinformatics and Data Science, Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Bioinformatics and Data Science, Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The Indonesia Colorectal Cancer Consortium (IC3), the first cancer biobank repository in Indonesia, is faced with computational challenges in analyzing large quantities of genetic and phenotypic data. To overcome this challenge, we explore and compare performance of two parallel computing platforms that use central and graphic processing units. We present the design and implementation of a genome-wide association analysis using the MapReduce and Compute Unified Device Architecture (CUDA) frameworks and evaluate performance (speedup) using simulated case/control status on 1000 Genomes, Phase 3, chromosome 22 data (1,103,547 Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms). We demonstrated speedup on a server with Intel Xeon E5-2620 (6 cores) and NVIDIA Tesla K20 over sequential processing. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CUDA; Genome-wide Analysis; MapReduce; Parallel Programming
Index Keywords: Diseases; Genetic programming; Parallel programming; Computational challenges; Compute Unified Device Architecture(CUDA); CUDA; Design and implementations; Genome wide analysis; Map-reduce; Parallel computing platform; Single nucleotide polymorphisms; Genes

Authors: Kacamarga M.F., Pardamean B., Wijaya H.
Title: Lightweight virtualization in cloud computing for research
Source title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Affiliations: Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kacamarga, M.F., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wijaya, H., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: With the advancement of information technology and the wide adoption of the Internet, cloud computing has become one of the choices for researchers to develop their applications. Cloud computing has many advantages, particularly the ability to allocate on-demand resources without the need to build a specialized infrastructure or perform major maintenance. However, one of the problems faced by the researcher is the availability of computer tools to perform research. Docker is a lightweight virtualization for developers that can be used to build, ship, and run a range of distributed applications. This paper describes how Docker is deployed within a platform for bioinformatics computing. © Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 2015.
Index Keywords: Big data; Bioinformatics; Cloud computing; Intelligent systems; Research; Soft computing; Virtual reality; Computer tools; Distributed applications; Docker; On demands; Virtualizations; Intelligent computing

Authors: Kanigoro B., Lie R.E., Kacamarga M.F.
Title: Overview of custom microcontroller using Xilinx Zynq XC7Z020 FPGA
Affiliations: Computer Science Program, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kanigoro, B., Computer Science Program, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lie, R.E., Computer Science Program, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kacamarga, M.F., Computer Science Program, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper presents an overview of customizable microcontroller using a Xilinx Zynq XC7Z020 FPGA as an alternative to increase its performance as user need. This alternative arises due to many of the systems, which developed mostly by using microcontroller are not giving any room for customization to increase its performance or I/O ports. There is any possibility that the system designed to be used by using general processor such as PC to increase its performance but it will give another problem such as interface difficulty for high speed I/O, real time processing, increases complexity, and many more. Customization is introduced by combining hard IP processor and FPGA in one chip instead of practicing two separate devices, processor and FPGA, which is commonly use in high performance embedded design. This approach allows seamless design development and development time reduction for customization.
Author Keywords: Customization; Embedded system; FPGA; Microcontroller; System-on-chip
Index Keywords: Controllers; Embedded systems; Field programmable gate arrays (FPGA); Microcontrollers; System-on-chip; As interfaces; Customization; Development time; Embedded designs; High speed I/O; Realtime processing; Seamless design; Separate devices; Integrated circuit design

Authors: Kacamarga M.F., Pardamean B., Baurley J.
Title: Comparison of conjugate gradient method and jacobi method algorithm on MapReduce framework
Affiliations: Information Technology Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kacamarga, M.F., Information Technology Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Information Technology Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Baurley, J., Information Technology Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: As the volume of data continues to grow across many areas of science, parallel computing is a solution to the scaling problem many applications face. The goal of a parallel program is to enable the execution of larger problems and to reduce the execution time compared to sequential programs. Among parallel computing frameworks, MapReduce is a framework that enables parallel processing of data on collections of commodity computing nodes without the need to handle the complexities of implementing a parallel program. This paper presents implementations of the parallel Jacobi and Conjugate Gradient methods using MapReduce. A performance analysis shows that MapReduce can speed up the Jacobi method over sequential processing for dense matrices with dimension ≥ 14,000. © 2014 Muhamad Fitra Kacamarga, Bens Pardamean and James Baurley.
Author Keywords: Conjugate gradient; Iterative method; Jacobi method; Mapreduce; Parallel computing
